meanings.definition: To strip of covering or surface layers
meanings.sent1: The strong wind can denuder the trees of their leaves in autumn.
meanings.sent2: The workers will denuder the old wallpaper before painting the walls.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to denuder the garden of all its flowers.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to denuder the canvas, revealing a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The river's current has the power to denuder the riverbank over time.

meanings.sent1: The denuder of the forest was a threat to the ecosystem.
meanings.sent2: The denuder carefully removed the outer layers to reveal the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent3: The little denuder in the story was actually a helpful character.
meanings.sent4: The denuder of secrets always had a mysterious aura around them.
meanings.sent5: The denuder of mysteries was known for solving the most puzzling cases.
